eiteam.esteemedinnovation.api.book

Class BookPageRegistry

  • java.lang.Object
    • eiteam.esteemedinnovation.api.book.BookPageRegistry

  • public class BookPageRegistry
extends java.lang.Object
    The registry for all book related stuff.

    It is very important to use *unique* keynames (unlocalized names) for your sections, categories, and entries.

    • Field Detail

      • sections

        public static final java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.Integer,BookSection> sections
        All of the Esteemed Innovation sections. This, logically, contains all categories, entries, and pages as well. The key is simply the stable position of the section in the book.

      • bookRecipes

        public static final java.util.Map<net.minecraft.item.ItemStack,org.apache.commons.lang3.tuple.Pair<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer>> bookRecipes
        All of the research pages showcasing crafting recipes.
        • Key: The output item.
        • Value: A pair of the entry name and the page number.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BookPageRegistry

        public BookPageRegistry()

    • Method Detail

      • addSection

        public static void addSection(java.lang.String name)
        Adds a simple section with no categories. It is probably better in most cases to use the version of this method that explicitly adds a BookSection instance (addSection(BookSection)).

        In order to use this, you first register the section with this name, and then use the other addTHING methods to append to the section. Again, it's recommended to use the other method instead with a fully constructed section.

        Parameters:
        name - The unlocalized name for the section.

      • addSection

        public static void addSection(BookSection section)
        Adds a research section.
        Parameters:
        section - The section.

      • addEntryToCategory

        public static void addEntryToCategory(java.lang.String name,
                                      java.lang.String category,
                                      BookPage... pages)
        Adds a research entry to a category. This will use the default BookEntry which is always unlocked. Use the other addEntryToCategory method to use your own custom BookEntry.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the entry.
        category - The category name.
        pages - The pages in that entry.

      • addEntryToCategory

        Parameters:

        pages - The pages to add to the entry.

      • addEntryPagesToRecipeList

        private static void addEntryPagesToRecipeList(BookEntry entry)
        Helper method that adds all of an entry's crafting pages (CraftingPage subclasses) to bookRecipes.
        Parameters:
        entry - The entry to add.

      • getEntryFromName

        public static BookEntry getEntryFromName(java.lang.String name)
        Parameters:
        name - The entry name to search for
        Returns:
        The BookEntry tied to the provided name. Null if it is not present in any category.

        Returns:
